class.name: YMenu
class.brief_description: A base menu class that provides menu stack management, transitions, and navigation functionality.
class.description:
YMenu is a specialized [Panel] class that provides core menu functionality including: - Menu stack management for handling multiple open menus - Smooth fade transitions between menus - Back button and UI cancel handling - Menu state management
YMenu automatically handles adding/removing itself from the menu stack and provides virtual methods that can be overridden in GDScript to customize menu behavior.
Example of basic menu usage: [codeblock] extends YMenu
func _ready(): # Set up back button var back_btn = $BackButton set_back_button(back_btn)
# Enable UI cancel (Esc key) to trigger back button ui_cancel_presses_back_button = true
func _on_started_menu(): # Called when menu is first shown print("Menu started!")
func _on_back_button_pressed(): # Custom back button handling print("Going back...") [/codeblock]

method.name: _can_back_button_auto_close_menu
method.description:
Virtual method that determines if pressing the back button should automatically close this menu. Override and return [code]false[/code] to prevent automatic closing.
Default implementation returns [code]true[/code].

method.name: _on_back_button_pressed
method.description:
Virtual method called when the back button is pressed. Override to add custom back button behavior.
The default implementation will close the menu if [method _can_back_button_auto_close_menu] returns [code]true[/code].

method.name: _on_back_to_menu
method.description: Virtual method called when returning to this menu from a child menu. Override to refresh or update menu state when it becomes active again.

method.name: _on_fade_out
method.description: Virtual method called when the menu starts fading out. Override to add custom behavior during the fade out transition.

method.name: _on_started_menu
method.description: Virtual method called when the menu is first shown. Override to initialize menu state or trigger animations.

method.name: add_to_menu_stack
method.description: Adds this menu to the global menu stack managed by [YEngine]. Called automatically when the menu enters the scene tree.

method.name: calculate_ideal_control_center
method.description:
Static utility method that calculates the position to center a control within its parent.
[codeblock] # Center a popup in its parent var popup = $Popup popup.position = YMenu.calculate_ideal_control_center(popup.size, get_parent()) [/codeblock]

method.name: fade_out
method.description:
Starts a fade out animation for this menu. Returns the [Tween] controlling the animation.
[codeblock] func close_menu(): var tween = fade_out() await tween.finished queue_free() [/codeblock]

method.name: get_can_click_buttons
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if buttons in the menu can currently be clicked. Buttons are clickable when: - The menu is active (top of menu stack) - Enough time has passed since the last button click (prevents rapid clicking) - The menu is fully visible (not mid-transition)

method.name: get_is_active
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this menu is currently the active menu (top of the menu stack).

method.name: instantiate_child_menu
method.description:
Creates a new child menu from the provided scene and adds it as a child of [param parent_node].
If [param auto_start] is [code]true[/code], calls [method _on_started_menu] on the new menu. The new menu will automatically connect its "go_back_to_menu" signal to this menu.
[codeblock] func _on_settings_button_pressed(): var settings_menu = instantiate_child_menu(get_parent(), preload("res://settings_menu.tscn")) [/codeblock]

method.name: instantiate_replacement_menu
method.description:
Similar to [method instantiate_child_menu], but removes this menu after creating the new one. Useful for transitioning between menus in the same layer of the menu hierarchy.
[codeblock] func _on_next_level_button_pressed(): instantiate_replacement_menu(get_parent(), next_level_menu_scene) [/codeblock]

method.name: is_top_of_menu_stack
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this menu is at the top of the menu stack.

method.name: remove_from_menu_stack
method.description: Removes this menu from the global menu stack. Called automatically when the menu exits the scene tree.

method.name: set_back_button
method.description: Sets up the back button for this menu. The provided control must have a "pressed" signal. When pressed, will trigger [method _on_back_button_pressed].

method.name: set_is_active
method.description: Sets whether this menu is active. If set to [code]true[/code], moves this menu to the top of the stack.

method.name: set_last_clicked_time
method.description: Updates the last button click time. Used internally to prevent rapid button clicking.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], automatically calls [method _on_started_menu] when the menu enters the scene tree.
If [code]true[/code], pressing the UI cancel action (usually Esc key) will trigger the back button functionality.

signal.name: go_back_to_menu
signal.description: Emitted when the menu is closing via back button navigation. Connected automatically to parent menus when using [method instantiate_child_menu].

signal.name: on_back_to_menu
signal.description: Emitted when returning to this menu from a child menu.

signal.name: started_menu
signal.description: Emitted when the menu starts ([method _on_started_menu] is called).
